strings: <se_low>Yangus: This spring's a bit cruel, eh? Why can't it make the Princess turn back to normal perm'nantly, like?

<se_def>Angelo: Poor Princess Medea...
She looks really distressed.
<se_def>Angelo: You're up, <hero>! Time to say a few words of comfort to the damsel in distress!
<se_high>Jessica: I wish King Trode had taken a drink from the spring, too! I've been curious to see what he really looks like!
<se_high>Jessica: But now's not the time, I suppose.
<se_low>King Trode: I wonder if that old chap will be able to find his way home on his own? He is blind, after all, so I can't help being rather concerned.
<se_low>King Trode: Maybe the old chap we met here is in the know about the magic mirror. We should go to his house and make some enquiries.

<se_low>Yangus: I was well gobsmacked!
So the 'orse-princess really is a proper princess!
<se_low>Yangus: Er, not that I was doubtin' wot you an' the old codger said or nuffin'. It was just funny seein' it wiv me own eyes, is all.
<se_def>Angelo: Looks like the only way to lift the Princess's curse is to do away with Dhoulmagus.
<se_def>Angelo: I wonder if the old man we met here before is the same man the scholar in Argonia mentioned?

<se_def>Angelo: Blast!
If only we'd thought of that earlier!
We could've asked him before he left.
<se_high>Jessica: We should come here from time to time and hear what the Princess has to say.
<se_high>Jessica: I feel a bit bad, making her pull the wagon all the time...
<se_low>King Trode: Naturally, as Medea's father, I'm positively over the moon that you're taking so much care to bring her here.
<se_low>King Trode: However, I'm afraid we need to find Jessica without a moment's delay. Loath as I am to say it, she's the priority for now.
<se_def>Angelo: If Jessica had said anything to the Princess before she disappeared, we'd be able to find out what it was here...
<se_def>Angelo: But I suppose it's not really likely that she would've done.
<se_low>Yangus: Maybe the 'orse-princess might know why Jessica went an' done a runner.

<se_low>Yangus: Only birds can understand birds, I reckon.
Even if one of 'em's an 'orse.
<se_low>King Trode: I positively refuse to drink any of that spring water. The reason I look this way is because of my own indiscretion, after all.
<se_low>King Trode: No, I must continue my journey in this unfortunate state until the sceptre is returned to Trodain and the curse is lifted.
<se_low>Yangus: Imagine if I drunk this spring water an' it magicked away all me extra pounds, eh!?
<se_low>Yangus: Far as I'm concerned, me beer belly's just like a curse, so I don't see why the water shouldn't work for me!
<se_def>Angelo: It's nice to come here and see the beautiful Princess in her true form. One of my favourite pastimes is looking at beautiful women.
<se_high>Jessica: The Princess seems to want to talk to you more than anyone, <hero>.

<se_high>Jessica: She's got a thing for you.
I can tell! It's so obvious.
<se_low>King Trode: I positively refuse to drink any of that spring water. The reason I look this way is because of my own indiscretion, after all.
<se_low>King Trode: No, I must continue my journey in this unfortunate state until the sceptre is returned to Trodain and the curse is lifted.
<se_low>Yangus: I s'pose we won't 'ave no need to come 'ere no more once Dhoulmagus is 'istory an' the 'orse<->princess is back to normal.
<se_high>Jessica: I feel terrible, watching the Princess gulping down water to prolong her time in human form.

<se_high>Jessica: We'd better hurry up and defeat Dhoulmagus,
or she's going to swell up like a water balloon!
<se_def>Angelo: Aaah... With our duty fulfilled and Dhoulmagus defeated, finally I can be free...

<se_def>Angelo: Oops! But we haven't defeated him yet,
so I suppose I'm getting ahead of myself.
<se_low>King Trode: Under normal circumstances, a princess should never have to put her head in the water and drink from a spring like this.

<se_low>King Trode: But she's a horse at the moment,
so I suppose it can't be helped.
It's terribly painful to watch, mind you.

<se_low>Yangus: The 'orse-princess is diff'rent to Red an' Jessica.
I s'pose it's cos she's royalty, like.

<se_low>Yangus: Not that she acts like a toff, mind you.
She's a bit of a myst'ry, really.
<se_high>Jessica: Coming here is so relaxing. It almost makes me forget about the crisis we're all facing.

<se_high>Jessica: I know we don't have time to take a break,
but still, it's nice to come here every once in a while.

<se_def>Angelo: If the Princess marries Charmless, you won't
be able to chat away to her easily any more,
you know.
<se_def>Angelo: So you'd better make the most of it now while you still have the chance.
<se_high>Red: Talkin' of types, you've got three pretty diff'rent women 'ere, eh, <hero>? So wot floats yer boat?
<se_high>Red: ...Ha ha, I'm only pullin' yer leg! Blimey, don't look so worried. I ain't gonna do nuffin' if ya say it ain't me. And I ain't gonna give ya nuffin' if ya say it is, either!
<se_low>Morrie: Incredibile! Inside the horse is hiding a bella donna! A beautiful and wise young girl.

<se_low>Morrie: Such beauty and wisdom must come from the parents, ay? From the mamma. ...Or the father,
of course. Si!
<se_low>Morrie: I, I do not wish to cause a fence, Don Toad!
<se_high>Red: I s'pose if you've spent as long as she 'as bein' an 'orse, it's gonna be 'ard to shake some o' the 'abits, eh? Even when yer back to bein' 'uman.
<se_high>Red: Like, ya know, lappin' up water from puddles an' eatin' grass an' stuff.
<se_high>Red: ...Blimey, I was only kiddin'! Lighten up, would ya? A little joke ev'ry now and then don't do no 'arm, does it?
<se_low>Morrie: Maybe it makes the Don Toad hop under the collar when I say it, but sometimes I am jealous of this curse that makes him into a monster.
<se_low>Morrie: Being inside the body of a monster means you can know the true heart of the monster. If it is me, I could become even greater friends with monsterkind!
